articles.title: Faster, Smaller AI Model Found for Image Geolocation
articles.summary: Imagine playing a new, slightly altered version of the game GeoGuessr. You’re faced with a photo of an average U.S. house, maybe two floors with a front lawn in a cul-de-sac and an American flag flying proudly out front. articles.title: You Can Cool Chips With Lasers?!?!
articles.summary: Modern high-performance chips are marvels of engineering, containing tens of billions of transistors. The problem is, you can’t use them all at once. If you did, you would create hot spots—high temperatures concentrated in tiny areas—with power densities nearing those found at the surface of the sun...

articles.title: Electrifying Everything Will Require Multiphysics Modeling
articles.summary: A prototyping problem is emerging in today’s efforts to electrify everything. What works as a lab-bench mockup breaks in reality.
